poem:
Title: "Excavating a Life" 

In each heartbeat, an epic, etching tales - 
Archaeologist aged, unearthing memory's yield. 
The thunderbolt's call, a seaman's oft' heard wail,
Curator of days, in life's gallery, revealed. 
Six strings strumming, bluesman's note, so frail,
A teacher's wisdom, by the film reel, concealed. 
Among waves and fractions, his story sets sail.
Goodbye, Alex Hooper, your lore in pictures sealed.
